title: About Me
text:
Hi, I’m Billy Mitchell
I’m a fifth-year PhD Candidate in Chelsea Helion’s Social and Affective Neuroscience lab who uses naturalistic paradigms to study neural representations of uncertainty, emotion, and self-regulation. I also co-direct the Coding Outreach Group which is a student-led organization aiming to increase computer programming literacy and to build an educational community with self-generated resources for coders of all levels.
I’d graduated from Loyola University Maryland, after which I coordinated some really interesting nicotine and cannabinoid studies at Johns Hopkins University and GI microbiome research at the Children’s Hospital of Philadelphia.
When I’m not working, I like hiking, playing Dungeons & Dragons (See my R functions in the DnDRuf Repo or my Combat Simulator App!), and making music.

title: NIH F99/K00 Information
text:
Contact & Acknowledgements
If you have any questions or concerns, please don’t hesitate to reach out at billy.mitchell@temple.edu. I’m happy to give some more advice or feedback. Also, I have to give a lot of thanks to Haroon Popal who massively helped me in preparing this application by letting me take a look at all of his materials.
